question.text: Recognize the figure and find out the CORRECT matching.

options.text: a-spermatozoa, b-spermatid, c-primary spermatocyte, d-secondary spermatocyte, e-spermatogonia, f-sertoli cell
a-spermatozoa, b-spermatid, c-secondary spermatocyte, d-primary spermatocyte, e-Sertoli cell, f-spermatogonia
a-spermatozoa, b-spermatid, c-primary spermatocyte, d-secondary spermatocyte, e-spermatogonia, f-sertoli cell
a-spermatozoa, b-spermatid, d-primary spermatocyte, c-secondary spermatocyte, e-sertoli cell, f-spermatogonia

solution.text: The testicular lobules which are the compartments in each testis contain highly coiled structures called the seminiferous tubules where the sperms are produced. The inner layer of the tubule is lined by male germ cells called the spermatogonia(f) and sertoli cells(e). These germ cells undergo meiotic divisions and produce and produce the primary spermatocyte(d) which again forms haploid cells called secondary spermatocyte(c). The secondary spermatocytes produce four haploid spermatids(b) by meiosis, these spermatids finally get transformed into spermatozoa(a).
